member.description: Create a new color object.

argument.name: colorSpace
argument.description: Color space id or object

argument.name: coords
argument.description: Color coordinates in its color space

member.description: Create a new color object.

argument.name: str
argument.description: String representation of color. See [`Color.parse()`](#Color.parse) for what's accepted.

member.description: Create a new color object.

argument.name: color
argument.description: Any object with a `coords` property, and optionally `spaceId` and `alpha`. Another color instance works too, and effectively clones the object.

member.name: coords
member.description: Coordinates of the color in its color space

member.name: alpha
member.description: Alpha transparency. Defaults to 1.

member.name: space
member.description: Color space object for the current color.

member.name: spaceId
member.description: Color space id for the current color, e.g. "srgb". Can be used to set the color space, which also transforms the coords accordingly.

member.name: white
member.description: White point of the color's color space. Equivalent to `this.space.white`. Defaults to `Color.whites.D50`.

member.name: luminance
member.description: Relative luminance.
member.returnDescription: The relative luminance of the color

member.name: contrast
member.description: Calculates WCAG 2.1 color contrast between this color and another one.

member.name: contrast
member.description: Static version of `color.contrast()`.

member.name: deltaE
member.description: DeltaE 1976 distance between the current color and another color. Plugins can add other methods.

argument.name: color
argument.description: The color to calculate DeltaE distance from.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object

argument.name: options.method
argument.description: Method, e.g. "76" or "2000"

member.name: inGamut
member.description: Is the color in gamut for a given color space?

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object.

argument.name: options.space
argument.description: The color space whose gamut we're checking against. Defaults to the current color space.

member.name: inGamut
member.description: Is the color in gamut for a given color space?

argument.name: color
argument.description: Color

argument.name: options
argument.description: Same as color.inGamut()

member.name: toGamut

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object.

argument.name: options.method
argument.description: How to force into gamut. If "clip", coordinates are just clipped to their reference range (don't do that unless you have a reason, it produces very poor results). If in the form [colorSpaceId].[coordName], that coordinate is reduced until the color is in gamut. Please note that this may produce nonsensical results for certain coordinates (e.g. hue) or infinite loops if reducing the coordinate never brings the color in gamut. Defaults to `"lch.c"`.

argument.name: options.space
argument.description: Color space whose gamut we are mapping to. Defaults to the current color space.

argument.name: options.inPlace
argument.description: If true, modifies the current color instead of returning a new one. Defaults to false.

member.description: Map color to a color that is within a color space's gamut.

member.name: toGamut
member.description: Static version of color.toGamut()

argument.name: options
argument.description: Same as color.toGamut()

member.name: to
member.description:
Convert the color to another color space and return the result as a new color.
Note that you don't need this to convert the current color to another color space, just set [Color#spaceId](#Color#spaceId) or [Color#space](#Color#space).

argument.name: space
argument.description: Color space to convert to.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object.

argument.name: options.inGamut
argument.description: Whether to also force the coordinates of the new color to be in gamut of its color space

member.returnDescription: The new color, or the current color, adjusted to fit in the specified gamut.

member.name: toJSON
member.description: Returns an object literal that can be serialized to JSON and then parsed and fed back to the Color constructor
member.returnDescription: Object with `spaceId`, `coords`, and `alpha` properties, so it can be used to recreate the same color.

member.name: toString

argument.name: options.precision
argument.description: Number of significant digits to round to. Defaults to 5.

argument.name: options.format
argument.description: If function, maps all coordinates. If "%", formats numbers in the 0-1 range as percentages. Keywords or other values tap into colorspace-specific formats (e.g. "hex").

argument.name: options.commas
argument.description: Whether to use commas to separate arguments or spaces (and a slash for alpha) [default: false]

member.description: Serializes the color to a string

member.name: parse
member.description: Parse a string as a color. Understands all [CSS Color 4](https://w3.org/TR/css-color-4) functions. Uses the DOM if present to parse hex colors and color names, so that will not available in non-DOM environments such as Node.js.

argument.name: str
argument.description: String to parse as a color.

member.returnDescription: An object with properties `spaceId`, `coords`, `alpha` that can be then passed to the `Color` constructor to create a new color.

member.name: convert
member.description: One-off convert coordinates between color spaces.

argument.name: coords
argument.description: Coordinates to convert.

argument.name: fromSpace
argument.description: Color space to convert from.

argument.name: toSpace
argument.description: Color space to convert to.

member.name: get
member.description: Get a Color object from the argument passed. Basically gets us the same result as `new Color(color)` but doesn't clone an existing color object. Mainly used internally, by functions that accept color arguments.

member.name: space
member.description: Return a color space object from an id or color space object. Mainly used internally, so that functions can easily accept either.

member.name: spaces
member.description: All registered color spaces

member.name: hooks
member.description: [Hooks](#Hooks) object to facilitate creating and using extension points in the code.

member.name: whites
member.description: All registered white points.

member.name: mix
member.description: Return an intermediate color between two colors

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object. Options are the same as `color.range()`.

member.name: mix
member.description: Return an intermediate color between two colors

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object. Options are the same as `color.mix()`.

member.name: range
member.description: Interpolate to another color and return a function that takes a 0-1 percentage and returns a color in the range.

argument.name: color
argument.description: Color to interpolate to.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object.

argument.name: options.space
argument.description: The color space to interpolate in.

argument.name: options.outputSpace
argument.description: The color space of the output. Defaults to the current color's color space.

argument.name: options.progression
argument.description: Function that takes a 0-1 parameter and returns a 0-1 number to control the progression and allow for non-linear interpolation. E.g. for a 2.2 gamma use `x => x ** 2.2`.

argument.name: options.premultiplied
argument.description: If true, interpolate on premultiplied values. Defaults to false.

member.returnDescription: Function that takes a 0-1 parameter and returns a color in that place in the range

member.name: range
member.description: Interpolate to another color and return a function that takes a 0-1 percentage and returns a color in the range.

argument.name: color
argument.description: Color to interpolate to.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object. Same as `color.range()`.

member.returnDescription: Function that takes a 0-1 parameter and returns a color in that place in the range

member.name: steps
member.description: Interpolate to another color and return an array of colors

argument.name: options
argument.description: Options object. In addition to the options listed here, it also supports all the options of `color.range()`.

argument.name: options.space
argument.description: The color space to interpolate in.

argument.name: options.outputSpace
argument.description: The color space of the output. Defaults to the current color's color space.

argument.name: options.maxDeltaE
argument.description: Max deltaE between consecutive steps.

argument.name: options.steps
argument.description: Number of steps. Note that if the `maxDeltaE` parameter is also provided, the returned steps may be more.

argument.name: options.maxSteps
argument.description: Maximum number of steps to return. This only makes sense if `maxDeltaE` is used.

member.name: steps
member.description: Interpolate to another color and return an array of colors

argument.name: options
argument.description: Same as `color.steps()`.

member.name: steps
member.description: Interpolate to another color and return an array of colors

argument.name: range
argument.description: Function returned by `color.range()`.

argument.name: options
argument.description: Same as `color.steps()`.

className.name: ColorSpace
className.description: Class for color spaces. Each color space corresponds to a `ColorSpace` instance.

argument.name: options.id
argument.description: Id of this color space, to be used in conversions etc

argument.name: options.name
argument.description: Readable name, to be used in user-facing UI

argument.name: options.coords
argument.description: Object of coord ids to coord metadata (range, refRange, name, type)

argument.name: options.base
argument.description: Base color space

argument.name: options.toBase
argument.description: Function that converts coords in this color space to coords in the base color space. Must perform chromatic adaptation if needed.

argument.name: options.fromBase
argument.description: Function that converts coords in the base color space to coords in this color space. Must perform chromatic adaptation if needed.

argument.name: options.formats
argument.description: Details about string formats to parse from / serialize to.

argument.name: options.epsilon
argument.description: Tolerance

className.name: util
className.description: Collection of utility functions. Available on `Color.util`, or as separate exports.

member.name: isString
member.description: Check if a value is a string (including a String object)

argument.name: str
argument.description: Value to check

member.returnDescription: true if value is a string, false otherwise.

member.name: type
member.description: Determine the internal JavaScript [[Class]] of an object.

argument.name: o
argument.description: Value to check

member.name: toPrecision
member.description: Round a number to a certain number of significant digits.

argument.name: n
argument.description: The number to round

argument.name: precision
argument.description: Number of significant digits

member.name: parseFunction

argument.name: str
argument.description: String to parse

member.description: Parse a functional notation and return an object. Used internally by [`Color.parse()`](#Color.parse)
member.returnDescription: An object with `name` (function name), `args` (Array) and `rawArgs` (string) properties.

member.name: multiplyMatrices
member.description: Multiply two matrices or vectors. Matrices are specified as multi-dimensional arrays, where every `A[i][j]` is the i-th column and j-th row. Does not do any dimension checking; it's a "garbage in, garbage out" function.

argument.name: A
argument.description: First matrix

argument.name: B
argument.description: Second matrix

member.name: adapt
member.description: Adapt a XYZ coordinates from one white point to another. Only supports D50 and D65 out of the box. but you can add support for more white points by importing the CAT module.

argument.name: W1
argument.description: White point to adapt from

argument.name: W2
argument.description: White point to adapt to

argument.name: XYZ
argument.description: XYZ coordinates to adapt

className.name: Hooks
className.description:
**This is for plugin authors. If you're not interested in writing plugins for Color.js, you can skip this.**
Hooks afford extensibility far beyond what can be achieved by overriding properties and methods, or using functions. Hooks allow plugin authors to change how Color.jsâ€™ internal code works, by adding custom callbacks to predefined points in the execution.
You can find available hooks by searching the source code for `hooks.run(` or `hooks.run(` in color.js.
If you need a hook that is not present, we typically accept pull requests for new hooks pretty easily!

The Hooks module exports both a hooks object that is used throughout Color.js (as a default export), as well as a `Hooks` class (as a named export) that can be used to create new sets of hooks.

member.name: add
member.description: Schedule a callback to be executed at a certain point in the source code.

argument.name: name
argument.description: Name of hook to add the callback to.

argument.name: callback
argument.description: Code to run at the given hook. The callback will be called with (typically) the same context as the calling code, and a single object as its only argument (typically called `env`) with writeable properties for various aspects of the calling environment.

argument.name: first
argument.description: Whether to prepend instead of append this callback to any existing callbacks on the same hook. Defaults to false.

member.name: run
member.description: Creates a hook for plugin authors to be able to add code to.

argument.name: name
argument.description: Name of the hook to create. By convention, it's in the form `[class name]-[function name]-[location in function body]`. Class name can be omitted if it's in `color.js`. Location in function body is typically things like "start", "end", or e.g. "before-conversion", "after-init" etc.

argument.name: env
argument.description: Object with properties to be passed to the hook's callback. This will also be used as the function context, unless it has a `context` property, then that is used as the function context.
